text: The Philippine Association for Language Teaching is an academic and professional association that helps teachers of English as a Foreign Language (EFL). It is often called PALT for short. Its offices are at the College of Education of the University of the Philippines in Quezon City. == History == PALT started in 1960. == Annual convention == PALT has a convention every year with papers, keynote speakers, workshops, and social events. Its first international convention was in 2001. == Partners == PALT has relationships with several other language teaching associations including: * English Teachers' Association of the Republic of China (ETA-ROC) * Far Eastern English Language Teachers Association (FEELTA) of Russia * Japan Association for Language Teaching * Korea Teachers of English to Speakers of Other Languages * TESOL International Association * Thailand TESOL (ThaiTESOL) == References == ==Other websites== *PALT Home Page *PALT on Facebook Category:Language education Category:Educational organizations Category:1960 establishments in Asia Category:1960s establishments in the Philippines Category:Organizations based in the Philippines
